TopicTitle: Anyone interested in persistent editor/debris eraser

Articles.Content:
Hi.

I got so fed up with all the debris laying around that I started working on little program called Kerbal Space Program - Save Editor. It basically allows users to delete VESSELS from persistent.sfs file easily. It will also allow users to delete debris automatically.

I've come across with another debris delete program somewhere but I couldn't find it nor did it work for me when I tried it a while back. If there's any interest for this sort of a program I could upload the file for anyone to use. I'm mainly doing this because I'm studying programming technology and I wanted some practice.

Also if there's already one around (one that works), let me know, I'd like to use it
Um, just set "Persistent Debris" in the control panel to some very low number, or even 0?

Once again Im doing this for practice and fun. I know I can just switch debris off but I like to keep it on. Adds to realism. Also my debris comes mainly from broken rovers and such.

But still, thanks for your input.
Pretty sure Haystack lets you "fly" debris, so you can end its flight.
Sorry but this project is a bit too useless. What about another project? think about something that can't be done in settings.
It would be nice to delete specific things but other than that not to useful. Still good to practice though!
There's a mod called something like "Debridement and Salvage" that automatically and gradually deletes debris. I like it a lot.

Sorry but this project is a bit too useless. What about another project? think about something that can't be done in settings.
